pages.text: Wingertshellicus is a worm-like arthropod known from Devonian Hunsr√ºck Slate, Germany. A characteristic feature of this arthropod is that of the several appendages, only three pairs are noticeably elongated. Researchers have speculated that this is an arthropod related to insects. However, later studies found that these appendages actually grew on the head, ruling out relation with insects.
